item.title: Towerborne Exiting Early Access, Coming To PS5 In February
item.content:encoded:
Towerborne, a Looter Brawler developed by Stoic and published by Xbox Games Studios, is leaving early access and launching as a full game on February 26, 2026. In addition to the Xbox platforms the game is currently available on, including PC, it will also be available on PlayStation 5. Along with the full launch, many changes are coming as part of the reimagined launch experience update.

Per Xbox, one of the major changes that current players may not be happy with is the game moving from free-to-play to a fully paid model. The game will start at $24.99 for the standard release and $29.99 for the more premium deluxe edition. However, one benefit of the new model is that the game will shift from always being online to a title players can buy once and play offline.

More of the Major Changes Coming to Towerborne 1.0 in February

In addition to the new paid release model, the game features multiple updates that enhance the player experience. For example, there’s an updated, complete story featuring a major antagonist, side quests, and an overhaul of the Bounty Board. There’s also a reworked difficulty system with a new Brutal difficulty for those seeking a truly challenging experience. Additionally, the Towerborne FAQ states that players can continue their character progression from Early Access; however, it recommends starting over and playing the game from the beginning.

During an interview as part of the New Game+ Showcase, game director Daniel McLaren and design director Shana Markham spoke about how important it was for them to listen to their player base and flesh out the story after it was originally intended for the narrative not to play a major role in the game and be more of a backdrop for the Looter Brawler experience.

Towerborne is currently available in Early Access for Xbox Game Pass subscribers, and Founder’s Packs can be purchased on PC via Steam.

For more news regarding Xbox games coming to PlayStation, learn more about Avowed’s impending release on Sony’s PlayStation 5.

Do you currently play Towerborne? Does it look like a game that you would be interested in? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: New Game Plus Showcase—Everything Announced
item.content:encoded:
It’s the first week of 2026, and we already have the first gaming showcase of the year. Introducing the New Game Plus showcase, an event led by creators such as Jake Lucky, Hun2r, Luality, and more. The roughly three-and-a-half-hour event featured deep dives and new looks at 45 games.

With that many games over that length of time, keeping up with it all can be difficult. That’s why we have everything announced for you below. You can either watch the show in its entirety, or simply go to the game you want to know more about.

The New Game Plus showcase began at 4pm ET/1pm PT, and aired on YouTube, Twitch, Twitter, Instagram, and TikTok. You can

You can check out every game that was shown down below, and leave your thoughts on what games stood out the most to you. You can also take the discussion further in the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

Deep Dish Dungeon

The Blood of Dawnwalker

Blind Descent

Prologue: Go Wayback!

item.title: Phasmophobia Dev Launches Game Publishing Label
item.content:encoded:
Kinetic Games, the development studio behind Phasmophobia, has announced the launch of a new publishing label to provide independent game studios with legal assistance, marketing support, and more.

Named Kinetic Publishing, the company aims to provide the support Kinetic CEO Daniel Knight wished he had when he was the sole developer launching the pivotal horror game in 2020. Kinetic Games has since grown to a team of over 30 individuals.

The Vision Behind Kinetic Publishing

In a press release, Knight touted the company’s growth, noting that it now has the capacity to support other studios. He also said that his experience will now allow him to provide the support he would have appreciated.

“It’s such an exciting time for indie game development, I can say that in the past five years I’ve learned so much. The fact we’ve grown so much as a company means we’re now in the place where we want to support studios who come under our wing, and provide the support I’d have appreciated at the start of my journey.”

Five of Kinetic’s senior members will head the Kinetic Publishing team, each overseeing their respective areas of expertise. Among them is Asim Tanvir, Kinetic’s Director of Marketing and Partnerships. In an interview with Game Developer, Tanvir encouraged developers interested in partnering with Kinetic’s new branch to be authentic and proud of their work, and to provide the best information possible to represent their game’s potential.

“Focus on the information that best represents your game and highlights its potential, as this will help you and our team, too. Also, be authentic and proud of what you’re working on. If you are, that will come through and shine in your submission. We’re really looking forward to seeing a variety of pitches come through.”

Kinetic Publishing aims to collaborate with small teams and individual developers worldwide. Specifically, they are looking for developers with a clear vision for their game who are about a year and a half from launch. Insider Gaming will continue to track Kinetic Publishing’s growth and provide additional details on the new label as more information becomes available. How do you feel about the developers of Phasmophobia getting into publishing? Sound off in the comments below.

For more from Insider Gaming, learn about Avowed coming to PlayStation 5. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Avowed Coming To PS5, Release Date Revealed
item.content:encoded:
Obsidian Entertainment is officially bringing Avowed to the Sony PlayStation 5 on February 17, 2025. In addition, a new anniversary update to the game introduces several new features for players to explore.

During the New Game+ Showcase on January 8, 2026, Avowed’s gameplay director, Gabriel Paramo, and lead character artist, Dimitri Berman, touted the amount of additions to the game including new character races coming and the feature of the New Game Plus, allowing players to start a brand new game with all of the previous items they collected through their first playthrough. However, weapons will reset to their default levels, requiring players to level them up again.

Other New Features Being Added to Avowed

Additionally, a new photo mode was announced, allowing players to take photos of their Envoy. There are also new character presets and numerous creative options for players, which Dimitri and Gabriel say they were unable to complete to their satisfaction in the lead-up to the game’s launch. The game, published by Xbox Game Studios, initially launched in February 2025 on Xbox platforms. However, as more Xbox exclusive games begin coming to New platforms with Microsoft’s “Everything is an Xbox” campaign in full swing, PlayStation players are now getting the chance to experience the world of the Living Lands in the Pillars of Eternity universe.

The Obsidian representatives stated Avowed would be available for pre-order on January 8, but as of this Friday, the PlayStation Store has not made the landing page accessible. Insider Gaming will report when PlayStation officially makes the game available for pre-order.

For more Avowed on Insider Gaming, check out our news of plans for the game to be a multiplayer take on Skyrim. Sound off on what you think about the game coming to PlayStation 5 in our official Discord server.

item.title: Mario Tennis Fever Will Have The Largest Roster In Series History
item.content:encoded:
A new Gameplay Overview trailer highlights features of the upcoming Mario Tennis Fever game, coming to Nintendo Switch 2. Among other highlights, it was confirmed that the game will feature the most playable characters ever available in a Mario Tennis game, including the debut of Baby WaLuigi.

Mario Tennis Fever was first announced during the September Nintendo Direct, in a segment focused on the 40th anniversary of the Super Mario Bros. franchise. In the new trailer released on January 8, 2026, there was a more detailed breakdown of the new features, including a look at the full roster, with debuts of Goomba, Baby WaLuigi, and more.

More Mario Party Tennis Fever Features

In addition to the extensive roster, the game features the new Fever Rackets. There will be over 30 rackets, each with its own ability. For example, the Shadow Racket creates a duplicate of the character you’re using to have your opponent see double. There is also a range of new modes. Nintendo describes the Mix It Up mode as a way to play matches with unique twists. For example, Ring Shot Mode, where players try to hit balls through rings to score points. Also, there’s Forest Court Match, where feeding Piranha Plants a stream of tennis balls expands the court.

There’s also the previously announced Adventure Mode, which features Mario, Luigi, Princess Peach, Wario, and WaLuigi being transformed into babies by monsters. With the help of Donkey Kong, who is acting as a babysitter, they must overcome challenges to return to normal.

In addition to all of the new information regarding Mario Tennis Fever, Nintendo also announced the first new colored Joy-Con 2 controllers. The new light purple and light green variants will arrive on February 12, the same day Mario Tennis Fever launches on Nintendo’s new console.

Speaking of the Nintendo Switch 2. New sales data show that the console’s holiday sales in its first year fell short of those of the original Nintendo Switch. Learn more about that here.

For more from Insider Gaming, read about eight of the top co-op games coming in 2026. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: DICE Awards 2026—All Award Nominees
item.content:encoded:
The Academy of Interactive Arts & Sciences (AIAS) has announced the full list of nominees for the 2026 DICE Awards.

This year’s awards feature 65 games across 23 awards. Of the nominees, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 and Ghost of Yotei lead the way with eight nominations each. Other games receiving multiple nominations include Dispatch (6), ARC Raiders (6), Blue Prince (5), and Death Stranding: On the Beach (4).

As far as the big award of the night, Game of the Year, five games are up for it. Those games are Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, Dispatch, ARC Raiders, Blue Prince, and Ghost of Yotei.

MORE DICE: Astro Bot Wins Game of the Year at DICE Awards – All Winners Revealed

The 29th Annual DICE Awards take place on Thursday, February 12 at 11pm ET/8pm PT from Las Vegas, Nevada. It will be hosted by Kind Funny founder Greg Miller and Stella Chung, and air on YouTube.

You can check out the full list of nominees below, and leave your thoughts on what games you feel deserve the recognition as the best of 2025 down in the comments and over in the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

Insider Gaming will have full coverage of the awards as well as be live in Las Vegas for the annual DICE Summit.
